excerpts.story: He begins working calculus problems in his head as soon as he awakens. He did calculus while driving in his car, while sitting in the living room, and while lying in bed at night.
excerpts.author: divorce complaint of Richard Feynman's second wife
excerpts.source: Paul Graham's best quotes at paulgraham.com

excerpts.story: She was lost in her own world, where the stars whispered secrets and the moonlight danced on the waves.
excerpts.author: Unknown

excerpts.story: The wind howled through the trees, carrying with it the scent of adventure and the promise of new beginnings.
excerpts.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

excerpts.story: In the depths of the ocean, a mysterious creature lurked, its eyes glowing with ancient wisdom and untold stories.
excerpts.author: H.P. Lovecraft
